marker.name: Deecee
marker.title: Deecee starting out
marker.text: DeeCee is a female hen harrier from an estate in Perthshire, named by the landowner and satellite tagged by RSPB in the summer of 2016.

marker.name: Deecee
marker.title: Northern bound
marker.text: DeeCee takes a trip north

marker.name: Deecee
marker.title: Moving to Mull
marker.text: DeeCee makes the journey away from her winter roost area to Mull

marker.name: Deecee
marker.title: Off to Argyll
marker.text: DeeCee heads to the Argyll area for the summer.

marker.name: Wendy
marker.title: Wendy starting out
marker.text: Wendy is a female hen harrier from an MoD base in Argyll, West Scotland, named by MoD police and satellite-tagged alongside her brother, Donald, in summer 2016 by members of the Scottish Raptor Study Group

marker.name: Wendy
marker.title: Going to Mull
marker.text: Wendy heads west to Mull for the winter

marker.name: Wendy
marker.title: Back to the mainland
marker.text: Wendy returns to the mainland for the summer

marker.name: Harriet
marker.title: Harriet starting out
marker.text: Harriet is a female hen harrier from the National Trust for Scotland's Mar Lodge Estate, in the Cairngorms National Park. She was satellite tagged by RSPB in partnership with NTS in summer 2016

marker.name: Harriet
marker.title: Heading south
marker.text: Harriet begins her journey south

marker.name: Harriet
marker.title: Harriet in Cumbria
marker.text: Harriet spends the winter in Cumbria

marker.name: Harriet
marker.title: Harriet settles in Perthshire
marker.text: Harriet begins her journey back to Scotland, before settling in Perthshire for the summer.

marker.name: Finn
marker.title: Finn starting out
marker.text: Finn is a female hen harrier from Northumberland, named after young conservationist Findlay Wilde, who was tagged in summer 2016 by members of the Northern England Raptor Forum and Scottish Raptor Study Group

marker.name: Finn
marker.title: Winter in Ayrshire
marker.text: Finn spends the winter in Ayrshire

marker.name: Aalin
marker.title: Aalin starting out
marker.text: Aalin is a female hen harrier from the Isle of Man, named by the Society for the Preservation of the Manx Countryside and Environment and satellite-tagged in summer 2016 by members of the Scottish Raptor Study Group and Manx Ringing Group

marker.name: Aalin
marker.title: Heading for Lancashire
marker.text: Aalin leave the Isle of Man and heads to the Lancashire area.

marker.name: Aalin
marker.title: Winter in Shropshire
marker.text: Aalin spends the winter in Shropshire

marker.name: Chance
marker.title: The journey south
marker.text: From this point, Chance began her first journey south

marker.name: Chance
marker.title: A trip to Wallasea
marker.text: In early Nov 2014, Chance is spotted & photographed at RSPB Wallasea reserve

marker.name: Chance
marker.title: At the south coast
marker.text: Near south coast of England

marker.name: Chance
marker.title: Arrival in France
marker.text: Chance arrives in France and settles down for her first winter (Nov-May) in the Pays de la Loire region

marker.name: Chance
marker.title: Back for the spring
marker.text: Chance arrives back in the UK in mid-May

marker.name: Chance
marker.title: Arrived in Scotland
marker.text: She arrives back in SW Scotland where she started but doesn't settle or breed this year

marker.name: Chance
marker.title: Heading south again
marker.text: After spending a couple months in Northumberland, Chance begins to move south once more

marker.name: Chance
marker.title: Flying to France
marker.text: After a journey of just five days, Chance arrives in France

marker.name: Chance
marker.title: Chance settles for the winter
marker.text: For the second year in a row, she settles down here for the winter (Oct-May)

marker.name: Chance
marker.title: Back to Scotland
marker.text: Chance arrives back in SW Scotland from France in early May after a journey of only 4 days

marker.name: Holly
marker.title: Bonny title 1
marker.text: Bonny text 1

marker.name: Elwood
marker.title: Elwood starting out
marker.text: Elwood was a male hen harrier from an estate in Banffshire, North Scotland, named by and satellite-tagged by RSPB in summer 2016.

marker.name: Elwood
marker.title: Settled down
marker.text: Elwood settled in the hills of Tomatin.

marker.name: Carroll
marker.title: Carroll starting out
marker.text: Carroll was a female hen harrier from Northumberland, named and satellite-tagged in summer 2016 by members of the Northern England Raptor Forum (NERF) and Scottish Raptor Study Group (SRSG).

marker.name: Bonny
marker.title: Bonny starting out
marker.text: Bonny was a male hen harrier from RSPB's Geltsdale reserve in Cumbria, satellite-tagged in summer 2016.

marker.name: Beater
marker.title: Beater starting out
marker.text: Beater was a male hen harrier from a nest on a private estate in the Cairngorms National Park, who was satellite tagged by RSPB in summer 2016.

marker.name: Donald
marker.title: Donald starting out
marker.text: Donald was a male hen harrier from an MoD base in Argyll, West Scotland, named by MoD police and satellite-tagged alongside his sister, Wendy, in summer 2016 by members of the Scottish Raptor Study Group.

marker.name: Hermione
marker.title: Hermione starting out
marker.text: Hermione was a female hen harrier from the Isle of Mull, off the coast of West Scotland. She was named by the University of Central Lancaster and satellite tagged by RSPB in summer 2016.

marker.name: Eric
marker.title: Caught on camera
marker.text: On 15th October, Eric was seen and photographed by Alfie Stanger in Deerness on the east mainland of Orkney.

marker.name: Doona
marker.title: Doona starting out
marker.text: Isle of Man - Manx female

marker.name: Jonee
marker.title: Jonee starting out
marker.text: Isle of man - Manx female

marker.name: Yangie
marker.title: Yangie starting out
marker.text: Wales - welsh female
